{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3345726,"name":"Jacob","username":"JDM2024","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/7bcc69/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-27T22:07:14.194Z","cooked":"

For competition, I am implementing a Sequential Command Group that groups a command that raises the arm, a command that shoots the note, and a command that returns the arm to its resting position. All of the commands work individually, but if I group the commands together, they do not work (doesn’t matter the combination or which ones I use first, second, third). I am pretty sure based on what I’ve seen in other posts that this is due to the isFinished() methods in my commands, but I cannot understand why this is. The commands end individually, but the Sequential group will not move on past the first command. I have attached the individual command files and the Robot.java file where I created the command group (line 94). If I could get some assistance with this, that would be amazing. Thank you so much for your help!

Robot.java (3.7 KB)
ArmToPosition.java (1.5 KB)
FloorArm.java (1.4 KB)
Shoot.java (1.3 KB)

Sorry, I have no time for a detailed look but my intuition says remove the while because you get stuck there. The execute takes care of the iterations so while isn’t needed and the isFinished() takes care of stopping the iterations.

    while (Math.abs(goalPosition - Robot.arm.getLeftArmPosition()) >= RobotMap.ARM_TOLERANCE) {
      Robot.arm.liftArm(RobotMap.ARM_SPEED * directionToGo);
    }
","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2024-03-27T22:49:47.368Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":51.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":460398,"topic_slug":"sequential-command-only-running-the-first-command","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sequential-command-only-running-the-first-command/460398/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3346542,"name":"Jacob","username":"JDM2024","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/7bcc69/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-28T18:51:13.366Z","cooked":"

So, I took out the while loops and just had the code that used to be in the while loop present in the execute section. However, now, when I just run one command (ArmToPosition), I can hear the motors turn on for a split second, but then nothing else happens. I think that the code is only running the execute() method one time before it is finished, but I display the isFinished() method to the SmartDashboard, and the isFinished() method remains false the entire time. Additionally, I took out all code from isFinished() method and just had it always return false, and it still only runs one iteration of execute(). I believe that if I fix this problem in one command, I can get my sequential command to work as well. If anyone has any suggestions on what is going on, that would be greatly appreciated. I have attached the command file as well as the code where I schedule the command in Robot.java. Thank you so much!

@Override
public void testInit() {
ArmToPosition armup = new ArmToPosition(30);
armup.schedule();
}

@Override
public void testPeriodic() {
limeLight.turnOffLights();
CommandScheduler.getInstance().run();
}

ArmToPosition.java (1.4 KB)

There might be another problem in Robot.java or my teleop command may be interfering with the ArmToPosition command, so I will include these below as well in case the problem isn’t found in the ArmToPosition command or how I schedule it. Thank you so much! Your help means so much to me and my team!

Robot.java (3.5 KB)

It seems odd that the SwitchDrive command requires all of your subsystems and that instances of it are scheduled as the default command for each subsystem. If any other command requires one of those subsystems, it will interrupt other commands that require that subsystem.

While I’m not familiar with your robot, I would expect that the SwitchDrive command would only require the drivetrain subsystem and not any of the others. Similarly, it would be the default command for the drivetrain subsystem only and not any others.
